column1: Title

Read specifications, such as blueprints, charts, or schematics, to determine machine settings or adjustments.

Code, classify, and catalog books, publications, films, audio-visual aids, and other library materials, based on subject matter or standard library classification systems.
Reserve audio-visual equipment and facilities, such as meeting rooms.
Check reference materials, such as books, news files, or public records, to obtain relevant facts.
Prepare, or supervise preparation of, all data, charts, plots, maps, records, and documents related to surveys.
Prepare illustrations or rough sketches of material, discussing them with clients or supervisors and making necessary changes.
Write press releases or other media communications to promote clients.
Monitor work productivity or quality to ensure compliance with standard operating procedures.
Arrange for typing, duplication, and distribution of material.
Direct technical aspects of newscasts and other productions, checking and switching between video sources and taking responsibility for the on-air product, including camera shots and graphics.
Monitor security system performance logs to identify problems and notify security specialists when problems occur.
Read trade journals and professional literature to stay informed on trends, innovations, and changes that affect media planning.
Search legal records, survey records, and land titles to obtain information about property boundaries in areas to be surveyed.
Analyze aerial photographs to detect and interpret significant military, industrial, resource, or topographical data.
Organize and string together raw footage into a continuous whole according to scripts or the instructions of directors and producers.
Oversee the daily performance of computer systems.
Check preliminary and final proofs for errors and make necessary corrections.
Implement energy schedules, including real-time transmission reservations or schedules.
Claim missing issues of periodicals and journals.
View monitors for visual representation of work in progress and for instructions and feedback throughout process, making modifications as necessary.
Design research projects that apply valid scientific techniques, and use information obtained from baselines or historical data to structure uncompromised and efficient analyses.
Prepare specifications, designs, or sketches for machines, components, or systems related to the generation, transmission, or use of mechanical or fluid energy.
Create novel computational approaches and analytical tools as required by research goals.
Develop or maintain archived procedures, procedural codes, or queries for applications.
Prepare operational or risk reports for management analysis.
Review reports of securities transactions or price lists to analyze market conditions.
Inventory and order materials, supplies, and services.
Order property insurance or mortgage insurance policies to ensure protection against loss on mortgaged property.
Develop ideas or material for columns or commentaries by analyzing and interpreting news, current issues, or personal experiences.

Enter data into Geographic Information Systems (GIS) databases, using techniques such as coordinate geometry, keyboard entry of tabular data, manual digitizing of maps, scanning or automatic conversion to vectors, or conversion of other sources of digital data.
Prepare and maintain sketches, maps, reports, and legal descriptions of surveys to describe, certify, and assume liability for work performed.
Coordinate judges' meeting and appointment schedules.
Route proofs with marked corrections to authors, editors, typists, or typesetters for correction or reprinting.
